titlestmt.titleproper: Lewis and Clark Trail Heritage Foundation Philadelphia Chapter records 1969-2005
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Lewis and Clark Trail Heritage Foundation Philadelphia Chapter records
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: The Philadelphia chapter of the Lewis and Clark Trail Heritage Foundation was founded by Frank Muhly in 1995 in order to "raise awareness of the historical, social, and cultural significance and heritage of the Lewis and Clark Expedition within the local area."

scopecontent.p: The records include correspondence, meeting minutes, financial records, reports, notes, clippings and other printed materials, photographs (prints, negatives, and slides), teaching materials, maps, and other items. The collection contains some documentation of the national Lewis and Clark Trail Heritage Foundation, including member, officer, and committee lists, and member handbooks.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
